#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Tacheddirt
#Text=Tacheddirt ( also Tachdirt ) is a small village high up ( 2314m ) in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco .
#Text=It is the highest settlement in the Rhirhaia valley , about 2.5 miles further up than Ikkiss .
#Text=The village is populated by about 200 or 300 people .
#Text=It has no road or track , but rather a winding footpath .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From Ikkiss ( see Ikkiss page for how to get there ) , it is necessary to walk to Tacheddirt , as there is no road or track more than the winding footpath .
#Text=The footpath is in some places slippery and dangerous for the mules and donkeys that are used .
#Text=From Ikkiss
#Text=it is quite difficult to find the path to Tacheddirt .
#Text=The path is the one which winds up behind a small concrete water duct ( by the school ) on the right of the path as you walk down the slope towards the town .
#Text=The route is only about 1.5 miles as the crow flies , but is probably 2 or 3 on foot .
#Text=From Imlil head East up the valley , through Tamatert , and over the pass .
#Text=Follow the track along the South side of the valley until you reach a ford over the river to Tacheddirt on the other side of the river .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The only way is by foot , no roads exist .
#Text=The village is n't very big anyway .
#Text=See
#Text=The village is clustered on the north side of the valley , on the lower slopes of the mountain , Angour .
#Text=The houses are all mud brick except for the French Refuge that was built here in the 90s( ? ) .

#Text=There are only about 100 homes in the village , most are in a clump on the East side of the village by the stream , a line of others extends outwards to the west along the top of a steep slope of scree .
#Text=There is a small reservoir in at the top of this slope to the North West of the village , which is used to produce electricity for an hour each day .
#Text=One of the few electric lights is in the French Refuge , which has a solar panel .
#Text=Do
#Text=The main reason for being here , for a traveller , is to hike in the surrounding mountains .
#Text=In all directions rise mighty snow capped ridges .
#Text=Many people just stay in the village one night , before moving on .
#Text=However it is often easier to set up a base camp in the village and do day hikes .
#Text=On the other hand the mountains are so huge , it is hard to get anywhere .
#Text=Two day hikes that are available are :
#Text=Hike Eastward , up the valley further to Tizi n ' Tacheddirt ( 3230m ) .
#Text=This way you 'll see locals from the village collecting small bushes for firewood .

#Text=At the top of the pass you can look over into the next valley , and either continue onwards to the next village , or ( if you have time ) climb the mountain to the left ( called ? ) , before returning to Tacheddirt .
#Text=Continuing East from Tizi n'Tacheddirt will bring you down to Iabessene and the Ourika Valley .
#Text=Hike northwards to the Tizi n'ou Addi pass .
#Text=From here there is a ( horribly ugly ) road for the ski centre in Oukaimeden .
#Text=From the pass it is an exciting unpathed scramble up the ridge to Jebel Oukaimedene 's peak ( 3262m ish ) .
#Text=Tacheddirt is a stop on a reasonably popular long ( two week ) trekking loop that visits Lac d'Ifni and Jebel Toubkal before reaching Imlil .
#Text=To continue on this loop head South from Tacheddirt over Tizi Likemt .
#Text=Note : All of this will be covered in snow in winter ! ! !
#Text=Weather , in the summer or winter can change very rapidly .
#Text=A thunder and hail storm can move in on a sunny cloudless day in minutes .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The French Refuge provides :
#Text=Food ( the carer makes a really yummy Tagine , just ignore all the ants crawling all over his kitchen ! ! ! )
#Text=Bottled Water ( Pretty vital up here , unless you 've brought a load with you , or have water purification tablets ) .
#Text=Note : the water here is far more expensive than you might be expecting .
#Text=The water has to get all the way from Marrakech to this village across dodgy tracks and up paths on a donkey 's back .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Either bring your own food or buy some at the French Refuge .
#Text=He makes yummy tagine and can get you bread from the bakery in Tacheddirt .
#Text=Food is also available at the new hotel .
#Text=Drink
#Text=There was a little shop on the way over the pass ( Tizi n Tamatert ) from Imlil which sold coca cola & mint tea .
#Text=This is n't really in Tacheddirt , but is some 2 hours ' walk away .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Either in a tent ( on a very hard surface remember your mat ) by the Refuge , or in the refuge .
#Text=A new hotel is being built here by the owner of the last hotel in Aremd , it was still under construction in May 2007 , but was open by May 2008 .
#Text=It provides comfortable accommodation and good food .
#Text=The terrace has first rate views across the valley .
#Text=Cope
#Text=This village has no roads , no electricity and no running water .

#Text=Even though there is a French Refuge , you should be prepared to survive on your own , should they run out of bottled water , etc. Some water purification tablets , matches , something to boil water in , etc are all probably a good idea .
#Text=Also a day or twos worth of emergency food in case you ca n't get any here .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Walk back to Ikkiss , Imlil or Oukaimeden .
